snippet: While their building remains closed, Sandy Hook Elementary students headed back to class at a different Connecticut school that was transformed into a “very cheerful and nurturing” environment.
abstract: Sandy Hook Elementary students head back to class in aftermath of the Newtown, Conn, shooting at different school seven miles away from their old one; officials say district has done 'remarkable ' job recreating the old school in new setting and providing cheerful, nurturing environment.

byline.contributor: Robert Davey and Elizabeth Maker contributed reporting from Connecticut, and Mark Santora from New York.

lead_paragraph: While their building remains closed, Sandy Hook Elementary students headed back to class at a different Connecticut school that was transformed into a “very cheerful and nurturing” environment.

headline.seo: A Desire for Normalcy as Sandy Hook Students Return to Class
headline.main: The Children of a Tragedy Are Returned to School Life
headline.print_headline: The Children Of a Tragedy Are Returned To School Life
